head.supplied: Cambewarra ¶ 24/11/90. ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ In going through my own collections lately, I found specimens of a Boronia which I found in 1886 on the Ph[…]yenara Mntn. Braidwood district. This Boronia will I ...

div.p: MRS 203/2, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921, 90/835, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney

In going through my own collections lately, I found specimens of a Boronia which I found in 1886 on the Ph[…]yenara Mntn. Braidwood district. This Boronia will I think prove new. I sent specimens at the time to Baron von Muller who said it is a Zieria, though doubtful in absence of flowers. After careful examination today I find that there can be no doubt about the flowers having eight stamens. As specimens of it are already in the Baron's hands since 1886 I thought it but right to aquaint him with the fact and sent him another specimen as proof of it. […]

I have requested Baron von Muller, in case he should find this Boronia new, to name it after Mr Brydges, and hope that this suggestion will meet with your approval; if so then I should request the Baron to name any plant, which may happen to prove new, and found by me either already or in the future, after Mr. Brydges, in case the Boronia in question should not be new. […]
